overview_of_class: This course, Creative Collaboration I, is designed to provide a creative arena where students can work together in a collaborative process to develop an original ensemble project for the stage. Participating in class as playmakers and/or performers, all students will engage in creative research and activities. The course will also consist of required reading, creative writing exercises, and character and scene improvisations. (The rehearsal process will require additional evening and/or weekend meeting time outside of class during the final 3 weeks.) The course will conclude with a public staged-reading of the play. Actual performance participation in the final production is not required, however all students will be actively involved in and responsible for a specific aspect of production. Although there is no prerequisite for this course, it is highly advisable that students have previously taken one of the performance courses, MIT/THEATRE143 Basic Acting or MIT 298 Principles of Characterization.
name: Creative Collaboration I
title: DOHA MIT 330-1-70 Creative Collaboration I
enrl_requirement:
Enrollment Requirements: Registration is reserved for sophomore, juniors, and seniors only.
Add Consent: Instructor Consent Required

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value:
• Prerequisites: None

  • Open to sophomores and above

  • Instructor permission is required; students should write the instructor for permission to register at:
    a-woodworth@northwestern.edu

  • Students must be present on the first day or they will be dropped from the class
